com.group4.ist412.icare412

Class HTTPServer.Response

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.group4.ist412.icare412.HTTPServer.Response
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Enclosing class:
    HTTPServer

    public class HTTPServer.Response
extends Object
implements Closeable
    The Response class encapsulates a single HTTP response.

      • getBody

        public OutputStream getBody()
                     throws IOException
        Returns an output stream into which the response body can be written. The stream applies encodings (e.g. compression) according to the sent headers. This method must be called after response headers have been sent that indicate there is a body. Normally, the content should be prepared (not sent) even before the headers are sent, so that any errors during processing can be caught and a proper error response returned - after the headers are sent, it's too late to change the status into an error.
        Returns:
        an output stream into which the response body can be written, or null if the body should not be written (e.g. it is discarded)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes this response and flushes all output.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • sendHeaders

        public void sendHeaders(int status)
                 throws IOException
        Sends the response headers with the given response status. A Date header is added if it does not already exist. If the response has a body, the Content-Length/Transfer-Encoding and Content-Type headers must be set before sending the headers.
        Parameters:
        status - the response status
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs or headers were already sent
        See Also:
        sendHeaders(int, long, long, String, String, long[])

      • sendHeaders

        public void sendHeaders(int status,
                        long length,
                        long lastModified,
                        String etag,
                        String contentType,
                        long[] range)
                 throws IOException
        Sends the response headers, including the given response status and description, and all response headers. If they do not already exist, the following headers are added as necessary: Content-Range, Content-Type, Transfer-Encoding, Content-Encoding, Content-Length, Last-Modified, ETag, Connection and Date. Ranges are properly calculated as well, with a 200 status changed to a 206 status.
        Parameters:
        status - the response status
        length - the response body length, or zero if there is no body, or negative if there is a body but its length is not yet known
        lastModified - the last modified date of the response resource, or non-positive if unknown. A time in the future will be replaced with the current system time.
        etag - the ETag of the response resource, or null if unknown (see RFC2616#3.11)
        contentType - the content type of the response resource, or null if unknown (in which case "application/octet-stream" will be sent)
        range - the content range that will be sent, or null if the entire resource will be sent
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • send

        public void send(int status,
                 String text)
          throws IOException
        Sends the full response with the given status, and the given string as the body. The text is sent in the UTF-8 charset. If a Content-Type header was not explicitly set, it will be set to text/html, and so the text must contain valid (and properly escaped) HTML.
        Parameters:
        status - the response status
        text - the text body (sent as text/html)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • sendError

        public void sendError(int status,
                      String text)
               throws IOException
        Sends an error response with the given status and detailed message. An HTML body is created containing the status and its description, as well as the message, which is escaped using the escape method.
        Parameters:
        status - the response status
        text - the text body (sent as text/html)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • sendError

        public void sendError(int status)
               throws IOException
        Sends an error response with the given status and default body.
        Parameters:
        status - the response status
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • sendBody

        public void sendBody(InputStream body,
                     long length,
                     long[] range)
              throws IOException
        Sends the response body. This method must be called only after the response headers have been sent (and indicate that there is a body).
        Parameters:
        body - a stream containing the response body
        length - the full length of the response body
        range - the sub-range within the response body that should be sent, or null if the entire body should be sent
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • redirect

        public void redirect(String url,
                     boolean permanent)
              throws IOException
        Sends a 301 or 302 response, redirecting the client to the given URL.
        Parameters:
        url - the absolute URL to which the client is redirected
        permanent - specifies whether a permanent (301) or temporary (302) redirect status is sent
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO error occurs or url is malformed
